intro: Montiastrum bostockii, commonly known as Bostock's montiastrum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a prostrate or ascending growth habit and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
